intro: Anodopetalum, commonly known as the sweetgum tree, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Sapindaceae. It is characterized by its distinctive, star-shaped leaves and showy, lantern-like clusters of flowers. The genus includes several species, with Anodopetalum bigelovii being the most well-known. These plants are native to North America and are often found in woodland and open areas. They produce small, spherical fruits that contain several seeds, contributing to their ecological role in various habitats.
